question: In Fig. P2.13 the 20°C water and gasoline are open to the atmosphere and are at the same elevation. What is the height h in the third liquid? <image 1>
description: The image depicts a vertical cross-section of a container divided into three sections. The top section contains water, the middle section contains gasoline, and the bottom section contains an unknown liquid with a specific gravity (SG) of 1.60. The water and gasoline are open to the atmosphere and are at the same elevation. The water layer is 1.5 meters thick, and the gasoline layer is also 1.5 meters thick. The height \( h \) of the unknown liquid in the bottom section is what needs to be determined.
